Pre-Game Insights: Wales are in a new era after the retirement of star player Gareth Bale.
The first round of the UEFA Nations League 2024-25 will include the Dragons hosting Turkey at Cardiff City Stadium.
Wales will be desperate to make an early statement in this match.
Turkey will start as slight favourites despite being the away team but the Welsh threat cannot be overlooked.
They went all the way to the Quarter-Final of the European Championship and performed well against strong opposition.
This will be an exciting clash for sure.
Others: Brennan Johnson has a wide variety of skill range that allows him to be deployed in several different roles including as a number 10 or as a winger.
Arda Guler's most extraordinary attribute lies in his dribbling prowess. He effortlessly takes on multiple defenders and with his low centre of gravity he can dribble past opposition players easily.
The average number of goals in meetings between Wales and Turkey is 1.6.
Their last meeting was a draw.
Wales score 0.8 goals in a match against Turkey and Turkey score 0.8 goals against Wales (on average).
